page.title: 05Walking and Sighting
page.content: The town is surrounded by breathtaking scenery and its waters provide safe moorings for many visiting sailing craft.St.Mawes castle built in the time of Henry VIII is a favourite point for tourists to visit and although just outside this block, deserves a mention,as visitors to this point of the Roseland Peninsula always visit this famous castle. {Walking and Sightseeing.}There are many coastal and countryside walks for tourists who prefer to see the beauty of the area at a slow pace. For those who like to visit old churches,then this area is of particular interest.The Parish Church of St.Just_in_Roseland,thought by many to be one of the most beautiful in England,was founded in Norman times, but has since been re built.Some parts date back to 1261. {PTO
